Nature of Reality.quote: Brahman is Reality (Sat), Consciousness (Chit), and Bliss (Ananda). (Taittiriya Upanishad 2.1)

Existence Absolute.quote: That which exists is One, without a second. (Chandogya Upanishad 6.2.1)

Supreme Bliss.quote: Brahman is Bliss. From Bliss all beings are born, by Bliss they are sustained, and into Bliss they enter after death. (Taittiriya Upanishad 3.6)

Unified Reality.quote: Where one sees nothing else, hears nothing else, understands nothing else - that is the Infinite. (Chandogya Upanishad 7.24.1)

Eternal Truth.quote: That which remains unchanging during the three periods of time, past, present and future, is called Sat. (Yoga Vasishtha)

Pure Awareness.quote: The Self is self-luminous without darkness and light, and is the reality which is self-manifest. (Atma Upanishad)

Divine Joy.quote: The knower of Brahman attains the Supreme. (Taittiriya Upanishad 2.1)

Ultimate Identity.quote: That thou art - Tat Tvam Asi. (Chandogya Upanishad 6.8.7)

Transcendent Being.quote: Higher than the high, deeper than the deep, this Self is infinite like space. (Maha Upanishad)

Essential Nature.quote: The Self is not this, not this (neti neti). It is incomprehensible, for it cannot be comprehended. (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 4.4.22)

Universal Consciousness.quote: As the sun illumines the whole world, so does the Self illuminate the whole universe. (Katha Upanishad 2.2.15)

Absolute Happiness.quote: Other joys are but particles of Its bliss. (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 4.3.32)

Divine Essence.quote: That which makes the eye see but cannot be seen by the eye, know That to be Brahman. (Kena Upanishad 1.6)

Supreme Knowledge.quote: By knowing That which is subtle, you will know everything. (Chandogya Upanishad 6.1.3)

Infinite Being.quote: The Infinite is where one sees nothing else, hears nothing else, understands nothing else. (Chandogya Upanishad 7.24.1)

Pure Experience.quote: It is the witness of all experiences but is itself beyond experience. (Mandukya Upanishad)

Divine Fullness.quote: That is full, this is full. From fullness comes fullness. (Isha Upanishad)

Eternal Present.quote: The Self is the eternal 'now', beyond time, space and causation. (Yoga Vasishtha)

Ultimate Reality.quote: All this is Brahman. This Self is Brahman. (Mandukya Upanishad 1.2)

Divine Light.quote: The light of consciousness is one, illumining all minds. (Yoga Vasishtha)

Supreme Peace.quote: Peace, peace, peace - the peace that passeth understanding. (Prasna Upanishad)

Absolute Truth.quote: Truth alone triumphs, not untruth. (Mundaka Upanishad 3.1.6)

Divine Unity.quote: All this is strung on Me like pearls on a thread. (Bhagavad Gita 7.7)

Cosmic Being.quote: In the beginning, this was Self alone, in the shape of a person. (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 1.4.1)

Perfect Wholeness.quote: That is whole, this is whole. From wholeness comes wholeness. (Isha Upanishad)

Divine Reality.quote: This Self is Brahman indeed. (Mandukya Upanishad 1.2)

Eternal Now.quote: The Self is the eternal now, beyond the divisions of time. (Yoga Vasishtha)

Ultimate Consciousness.quote: Consciousness is the lamp that illumines all. (Yoga Vasishtha)

Supreme Self.quote: The Self alone exists. All else is Its manifestation. (Vivekachudamani)
